entry.title: Merry Gang (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that members of the aristocratic Merry Gang during the Stuart Restoration fought watchmen and destroyed a valuable royal sundial (pictured)?

entry.title: 43 songs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that across her first three albums, Alessia Cara co-wrote 43 songs ranging in themes from teenage, her insecurities about writing music alone, to the five stages of grief?

entry.title: Carson Spiers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Carson Spiers and four of his relatives have played for the Clemson Tigers?

entry.title: Skinpah (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the historical lands and fishing grounds of the Skinpah were buried underwater by the construction of The Dalles Dam?

entry.title: Harris Turner (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that one year after Private Harris Turner was blinded in battle, his fellow soldiers elected him to the Legislative Assembly of Saskatchewan?

entry.title: Saints Peter and Paul Seminary (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Saints Peter and Paul Seminary, the last Catholic high school seminary in Ohio before its closure in 1990, was designed with influences from Chinese architecture?

entry.title: John Byrne (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that John Byrne retold the origin of Superman in the 1986 comic book limited series The Man of Steel, 48 years after the character was created?

entry.title: Tip (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Canadian rock band Rainbow Butt Monkeys changed their name to "Finger Eleven" before releasing their second album Tip?
